content_translation.en:
First, determine your **goals** clearly. Create a **specific plan** where your tasks will be **prioritized**. Start with small and **achievable steps**, because big tasks can feel **overwhelming**.

Use **time blocking** to allocate specific time for your work. Set **deadlines**, which will keep you **accountable** and help you finish tasks. Also follow the **Pomodoro technique**тАФwork for 25 minutes and take a 5-minute **break**. This will increase your **focus**.

Try to stay away from **distractions**. **Eliminate** **social media**, **notifications** and other unnecessary things. **Reward** yourself after completing small tasks, because this will increase **motivation**. Keep your **mindset** positive and **visualize** yourself on the path to success before starting work.

**Finally**, **review** your **progress** regularly. If you ever fall behind, don't blame yourself but **restart** quickly. Gradually, by maintaining **consistency**, you can get freedom from **procrastination** and your **productivity** will increase many times.
content_translation.bn:
